answers.answer: Hello,Tingling sensation of the penis can be due to anxiety, contact dermatitis, traumatic damage to the nerves of penis, diabetes, prostatitis, genital herpes, urethritis and STD’s like Gonorrhea and Syphilis. The typical symptoms of prostatitis are fever, pelvic, testicle, or rectal pain, frequent and painful urination and ejaculation and incomplete emptying of bladder.I would suggest you to keep the area clean and wear cotton underwear. Also apply a mild steroid cream on the penis. If the symptoms persist then the above said conditions have to be ruled out. Please consult a urologist in that case.

question: Hi, I'm a 35 year old male and have been married to the same person for 10 years. no other partners. about 2 weeks ago or so I started getting a slight burning and tingling feeling on the tip of my penis.I went to the doctor and they tested me for uti, gonorrhea, and chlamydia.  all came back negative. they also gave me a one time pill for yeast infection. that was a week ago. it went away for a few days after the pill but is now back. it does not seem as bad.just a slight burning and it burns when pee for a sec. then stops. sometimes feels like slight tingling or tickling feeling. any advise
title: burning and tingling on head of penis
